relation: Delays generation of the start accounting record until the user IP address is established.
Displays debug messages for POD packets.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Security Command Reference: Commands A to C - aaa max-sessions through algorithm [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {17709=On platforms with multiple interfaces (ports) per slot, the Cisco RADIUS implementation will not provide a unique NAS-Port attribute that permits distinguishing between the interfaces. For example, if a dual PRI interface is in slot 1, calls on both Serial1/0:1 and Serial1/1:1 will appear as NAS-Port = 20101 due to the 16-bit field size limitation associated with RADIUS IETF NAS-Port attribute., 10134=On platforms with multiple interfaces (ports) per slot, the Cisco RADIUS implementation will not provide a unique NAS-Port attribute that permits distinguishing between the interfaces. For example, if a dual PRI interface is in slot 1, calls on both Serial1/0:1 and Serial1/1:1 will appear as NAS-Port = 20101 due to the 16-bit field size limitation of the RADIUS IETF NAS-Port attribute., 43753=Number of estimated AAA maximum sessions. The range is from 1024 to 64000.}

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description max-sessions aaa no maximum-number-of-sessions max-sessions aaa To set the maximum number of simultaneous authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) connections permitted for a user, use the aaa max-sessions command in global configuration mode. To disable the maximum number of sessions, use the no form of this command. aaa max-sessions algorithm alg sip timer alg sip processor alg sip blacklist alert-severity alert (zone-based policy) alert administrator authorization list administrator authentication list addressed-key address ipv6 (TACACS+) address ipv4 (GDOI) address ipv6 (config-radius-server) address ipv4 (config-radius-server) address ipv4 address (IKEv2 keyring) address add (WebVPN) activate action-type acl drop acl (WebVPN) acl (ISAKMP) accounting dhcp source-ip aaa list accounting acknowledge broadcast accounting (server-group) accounting (line) accounting (gatekeeper) accounting access-template access-session accounting access-restrict access-profile access-list remark access-list dynamic-extend access-listcompiledipv4limitmemory access-listcompileddata-linklimitmemory
textAfterTable: Command History Release Modification 15.0(1)M This command was introduced in a release earlier than Cisco IOS Release 15.0(1)M. 12.2(33)SRC This command was integrated into a release earlier than Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SRC. 12.2(33)SXI This command was integrated into a release earlier than Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SXI. Cisco IOS XE Release 2.1 This command was integrated into Cisco IOS XE Release 2.1. Usage Guidelines The aaa max-sessions command enables you to set the maximum number of simultaneous connections permitted for a user. The aaa max-sessions command can be used only if the aaa new-model command is configured. Examples The following example shows how to adjust the initial hash size for the maximum number of simultaneous AAA sessions:  Router# configure
